inputs.remark:
Ordered list: Add otoscopy; neurological exams (MRI, EKG, EEG, MRA).
V2: Missing SOAE repeated 2 weeks later with same result.
V3: Should equal expected outcome.

logic_summary: Added Neurological exams (MRI, EKG, EEG, MRA) to ordered_list.
Added V2 to expected_interpretations_by_visit for the repeat SOAE test mentioned in the text.
Added V3 to expected_interpretations_by_visit to reflect the 3-month outcome described in the text and expected_outcome.

value.rationale_short: To assess the ear canal and tympanic membrane.
To identify the origin of the perceived music and rule out central pathology.

value.collective_interpretation: Repeat SOAE testing 2 weeks later confirmed the initial findings.

tests.name: Spontaneous otoacoustic emissions (SOAEs)
tests.result_summary: Repeated 2 weeks later with same result (Present Right, Absent Left).

value.collective_interpretation: Patient elected to continue wearing hearing instruments. After 3 months, reported significant improvement in ability to recognize speech but no reduction in musical hallucinations. Reported gradual habituation and rated perception as half as annoying.

tests.name: Follow-up Assessment
tests.result_summary: Significant speech improvement; habituation to hallucinations; no reduction in hallucination intensity.
